newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: CapGemini has 96 sales growth in all units.
newsitem.headline: CapGemini has 96 sales growth in all units.

text.p: Software firm Cap Gemini NV said on Thursday 1996 net profits jumped 25.3 percent to 90.2 million guilders on the back of healthy sales growth across all its divisions.

The group said 1996 had been an excellent year, leading to a 16.1 percent growth in overall sales. However sales growth slowed slightly to 15.7 percent in the second half from 16.5 percent in the first. Operating profits continued to grow at a steady rate due to a slowdown in costs growth.
It said operating margins improved to 13.8 percent in 1996, while net margins rose to 9.1 percent.
The firm is proposing a dividend of 1.75 guilders per share, 30 percent up on the 1.35 guilders of 1995.
Cap Gemini said it expected further market growth in 1997, particularly in the area of concurrent transformation -- the integration of purpose-designed software into new corporate strategies.
Other growth areas include internal corporate networks (intranets) and systems conversion to cope with the introducton of the single European currency and the year 2000.
But it said it was too early to give a firm forecast of company earnings for the year.
